title: Why do I like rock but hate metal? - Quora

response.answer_text: I know a lot of people who would ask the same question, but that happens after I recommend to them some really good metal bands and they don’t seem to understand why I like metal myself. Firstly, metal is an acquired taste. Most people don’t listen to it for the first time in their life and go ‘Hey this is great!’ A lot of metalheads (me included) start out with listening to less heavy styles of music; one of them is rock. Others may start out with classical music (a lot of classical musicians are known to like metal). Even dubstep listeners start to like metal after they listen to some of it. Now these metalheads-in-the-making wouldn’t really like the music when they first listen to it. I’m thinking I’m not alone when I say it’s hard to get accustomed to the sound of metal at least. But after your ears adapt to the sound, oh man. So many other styles are now open for you to explore. The metal genre is sooooo huge. Calling it a subgenre of rock would be like calling physics a sub-field of math. Sure, you can use equations to simplify physics, but as of right now, both physicists and mathematicians are doing their own, distantly related things. What I’m going for is, either your ears haven’t gotten accustomed to the sound of metal, or you haven’t started out with metal in the recommended manner (which is, according to me, Led Zeppelin, Black Sabbath, Judas Priest and any other ‘old’ metal band, then Iron Maiden, then the big four) This order can change from person to person, though. Or there’s a third possibility that you really can’t tolerate metal, which is fine. I know lots of people who listen to all kinds of music but are perfectly fine with not listening to metal music. They have their own tastes and are fine with it. But it’s still good to at least try out good metal music. If everything else fails, there’s always lighter forms of metal (look them up). Who knows, maybe you’ll start to love metal after some time?
